subject: Re: [junit] Testing of object-oriented programs
msgSnippet: Shashank, Welcome aboard!  Sorry to answer a question with a question, but what frustrated you while learning or using unit testing?  What did you find
messageBody:
Shashank,

Welcome aboard! Sorry to answer a question with a question, but what
frustrated you while learning or using unit testing? What did you find
yourself doing repeatedly that really could have been automated? What
confused you and wasted your time?

If you start with answers to these questions, you're probably well on
your way to identifying a way to contribute to the community. Actually,
just answering them here would probably be a contribution, since it
might lead other people to new ideas.

David

Shashank Kalra wrote:
> Hi all !!
>
> Its nice to be part of a group with people who have experience in the
> field of testing and oop
>
> I've used unit testing as part of a small project and now i want to
> work on the field "testing of object-oriented programs" by making some
> plugin in eclipse or extending some testing functionality in junit etc etc
>
> I would really like some help on what can i do and how to start with
> this thing.
>
> thanking you all in anticipation,
>
> Shashank
